title: A Bayesian Approach to OOD Robustness in Image Classification
abstract: arXiv:2403.07277v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: An important and unsolved problem in computer vision is to ensure that the algorithms are robust to changes in image domains. We address this problem in the scenario where we have access to images from the target domains but no annotations. Motivated by the challenges of the OOD-CV benchmark where we encounter real world Out-of-Domain (OOD) nuisances and occlusion, we introduce a novel Bayesian approach to OOD robustness for object classification. Our work extends Compositional Neural Networks (CompNets), which have been shown to be robust to occlusion but degrade badly when tested on OOD data. We exploit the fact that CompNets contain a generative head defined over feature vectors represented by von Mises-Fisher (vMF) kernels, which correspond roughly to object parts, and can be learned without supervision. tldr: 本文提出了一种基于贝叶斯方法的图像分类中OOD鲁棒性解决方案，利用扩展的组合神经网络和von Mises-Fisher核来处理真实世界的OOD问题。
en_tdlr: This paper introduces a Bayesian approach to OOD robustness in image classification, utilizing an extended Compositional Neural Network and von Mises-Fisher kernels to address real-world OOD challenges.
